website_summaries.verdict: A quiet, quality cleaning robot that cleans hard floors well.
pros: This unit gets top marks for being unobtrusive with its quiet motor and low-profile design
Owners praise its ability to clean well, especially on hardwood floors, and many feel it works as advertised
It also stands out for being easy to use
cons: Occasional problems with GPS navigation feature and leaking
Some have issues using this model in larger homes or those with vaulted ceilings

website_summaries.verdict: For $300 (or £260) the Braava might be tempting, but consider holding out for something smarter, more powerful, and with more features.
pros: Braava's claims that its bot runs "whisper-quiet" are totally accurate
For removing dust and light dirt, and other basic cleaning jobs, the Braava 380t performed capably well
cons: You can't schedule automatic cleaning runs with the Braava 380t, and it won't automatically return to its charging dock when finished
Also, it was almost totally unable to clean grout

customer_reviews.title: Further annoying thing is its warranty for the battery is exactly ...
customer_reviews.text: The BATTERY is really disappointing. I purchased it on July 2017. Now in Jan 2018, just after 6 MONTHS OF LIGHT USING, the battery is dying. Further annoying thing is its warranty for the battery is exactly 6 month. I cannot understand it. For light usage of 1-2 times/week, a battery can die. We pay so much for a machine, and we only get the cheapest battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Until the manufacturer address this issue (also raised by some other reviewers) I do not recommend buying this product
customer_reviews.text: There is a design/construction issue which cases plastic trays shatter. During 1 year of moderate use I have replaced 4 of them so far. Until the manufacturer address this issue (also raised by some other reviewers) I do not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: V. Z.

customer_reviews.title: which is awesome. Now my living room is dust
customer_reviews.text: If you have hardwood floor, look no further, this thing is a must. I also have a robot vacuum, but this thing is silent and can be run when you are in the room, which is awesome. Now my living room is dust, pet hairs and stain free all week long, with very little effort! If your room is big and the robot loses the signal, purchase another navigation cube and place it properly. See picture attached as an example.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made a mess, . .quietly.
customer_reviews.text: This item was amazingly quiet, however, it left puddles of water on my floor (which is glossy, large white tiles), but in other areas it left smear marks. I even had it go over the original area a second time with no better results. I finally gave up and I had to clean my floor with a mop once it had finished. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: WrongBus2

customer_reviews.title: Want to waste $300 then buy me!
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. This unit is weak and just pushes dirt around. The battery didn't last, it literally spun in circles confused and didn't really do anything. At least my kids had a blast calling it a broken robot. Returned immediately and purchased the Scooba 450 instead. Now life is grand with clean floors, a non broken robot and more time to spend with the family. Don't waste your time or money on this device.
customer_reviews.author: Kesich Family

customer_reviews.title: DOES A GREAT JOB!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about a month now and my wife loves it. We have a 2700 sq. ft. home that has all tile. We are able to do the full house with only 3 locations for the cube. We get close to a 1000 sq. ft. of coverage each charge. So far the battery has been very impressive on how long it keeps the Braava going before running out of charge. My only compaint it that the unit does not return to its starting point before shutting down and several times we have had to retreive it from under some furiture when it ran out of power.
customer_reviews.author: AZ bliss

customer_reviews.title: The robot never able to get back to the base and we had to look for it every day!
customer_reviews.text: The robot always gets stuck somewhere and we had to search the entire house for it every day!! Finally the robot just disappeared and we were not able to find it any more. We searched under the sofa, bed and everywhere. The worst purchase and the worst product!
customer_reviews.author: Huawei Z.

customer_reviews.title: very very happy with this unit
customer_reviews.text: very very happy with this unit. Working it 2 times a day. We will see how long the battery lasts. I only use swifter sheets, no washing, but for wood floors in summer, it's awesome, gets hairs, fur, little bits of plants, seeds, dust. Invaluable when you have dogs and little time. Still have to pull out the big vacuum now and again, but this keeps things nice in the mean time. Works well on tile too. Have had this almost a year now. Still going strong, one battery replacement. Using it once a day. Plan to buy a few more. I still am a little that they can die, so will probably purchase the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: H. Choi

customer_reviews.title: completely replaces our mop
customer_reviews.text: After my mom fell in love with my Roomba purchase, she was lamenting that there wasn't an automatic mop. A quick search on irobot's website says otherwise. This braava has completely replaced our mop. It's great for our tiled floors. I wouldn't say it's good for deep cleaning, I think we'll still have to use the steam mop for that. We've had this for half a year and the value for dripping water broke. I don't find it to be a problem because I like the cloth to be completely wet from the beginning anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver.
customer_reviews.text: I have had an iRobot vacuum for years. I tried the Scuba and didn't care for it. My floors transitioned form mostly carpet to hardware and tile and I have three large dogs. I needed a stop gap between mopping. I tried one of the Chinese knockoffs (don't make that mistake - junk is junk). I just recently purchased this and I love it. It does a great job and is very efficient at getting everything and getting under things that are difficult to get to. I particularly enjoy watching it do my wood look porcelain tile floor board by board.
customer_reviews.author: FL in the burgh

customer_reviews.title: Second time around working well
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for cleaning up muddy doggie prints during the rain. Not for deep cleaning but a great tool for what we needed it for. Worked great for just past the return month then died with no explanation and was not recoverable. We got Amazon to honor a return even though it was past the date. We tried two other robo-mops which we promptly returned before we bought a second one of these. We did purchase the three year warranty, I don't like having to pay extra for a company to honor quality but that is the state of the world these days. I bought it again so that speaks to it compared to the other two we tried..
customer_reviews.author: LanceBaldwin

customer_reviews.title: Major flaw in the construction of the wet mopping hardware ...
customer_reviews.text: Major flaw in the construction of the wet mopping hardware. After 5 uses the plastic reservoir was cracked and breaking apart (see photo). They need to change the plastic they use to a different type that doesn’t crack with warm water and cleaning solutions. Picture: Top is a brand new reservoir, bottom is the original one after 5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: rollercoastergeek

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mop!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years, 8 months ago. It’s amazing! It makes nice neurotic paths on my hardwood and cleans the whole floor, even between chairs most of the time. When it starts to act funny - beeping or stopping after mopping 1/2 of the first room - it just needs a new battery. Those are not expensive. Love that you can fill the canister with plain water or add a bit of cleaning solution. The cloth collects spare cat hairs that escaped the broom. Absolutely worth the money - I’d buy it again but it looks like it will live for years more.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer53662

customer_reviews.title: Nice mopping bot for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for touch-up mopping or a whole room. Quality built, great battery life. You can use their microfiber cloths, any of the dozens online, or simply make your own. Fill the reservoir with water, distilled vinegar and a cap full of a natural "green cleaner", place the lighthouse in the middle of the room, and push a button. The lighthouse directs the Braava to cover the entire area, and do it again, depending on size of room and battery life. Just wish there was a way to use it on iRoomba app and set a achedule.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A solution looking for a problem
customer_reviews.text: This is a clever, well-built little machine. As other reviewers have written, it's quiet and simply goes about its business. Call me a grumpy old man, but I now must ask if the machine and all of its wondrous technology is really necessary to damp mop a hard-surfaced floor? Who is so busy or inept they can't use a broom, vacuum and/or wet cloth to clean a floor? I learned housekeeping skills from my dear mother, my big sister and a series of Army drill sergeants. Until my knees explode or I keel over, I defy this gadget to match or exceed my ability to clean the kitchen floor.
customer_reviews.author: DJS

customer_reviews.title: Tire tread or wheel not a replaceable part from iRobot
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed with the after sale service from iRobot. While working, the mop does a decent job on hardwood floor and does ok with kitchen tile. It helped reduce the manual cleaning until one of the tire tread became loose. Apparently there is no official replacement part available from iRobot to address this issue. 3rd party tire treads requires it to be glued and didn't stay on. For a tear and wear item like tire thread, i expected iRobot to offer a wheel replacement option.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The wheels leave black marks
customer_reviews.text: I used it about two weeks. Even when it was working at its best, it's definitely only a supplemental items. I would order new wheels but I guess that's not an item that you can purchase. I came out of the bedroom to find black lines from the wheels all over my hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Joellen Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Swiffer Wet Jet Does a Better Job than this Thing! Save your $!
customer_reviews.text: HA! Been meaning to write this for months. Also meant to return the thing but with my out of town work schedule I missed the return cutoff date, so now I’m stuck with a useless “spritzer mop”. Literally that’s all it does is “spritz” a fine mist of cleaner on your floor & barely wipes a rag over it. There’s NO SCRUBBING this thing does. It’s merely a fancy & expensive Swiffer Wet Jet. Motorized. Biggest waste of $ ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This mopping robot is just really not that great. It sounds nice to be able to just hit a button and have your floor mopped, but by the time you fill up the reservoir and attach the mop pad and set up the navigation cube, you really just might as well use a Swiffer. A Swiffer or a regular mop will do a better job. This is more of a in-between regular moppings item. It's really expensive for what it does. Mine also won't charge anymore after about a year, but I don't even care enough to get it fixed. I'd rather just mop normally, and I'm a very lazy person.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: nice little robot broom/mop
customer_reviews.text: this is not a replacement for a human being putting in effort for your dirty floors, but it is a nice thing to use to keep dust and general grime away. my kids enjoy putting the swiffer wipes on it and they actually fight over who gets to do that, and they enjoy watching it move around the house which is a bonus. but it is not going to sweep your floors after a messy meal and get everything, i just dont think any of these gadgets are capable of that. maybe in 2050.
customer_reviews.author: DMV Mom

customer_reviews.title: Makes my life easier
customer_reviews.text: Great little robot cleaner. We call him "Wall-E" and he is constantly used in the house - two cats - hardwoods throughout. I use Swiffer pads in addition to the micro clothes provided usually because of this. I flip them over and use both sides. I may get another for coverage. Maybe should have gotten a bigger one to begin with, but it's smaller size allows it to sweep under chairs and other low furniture with no issue. Wall-E sometimes gets stuck under a couch but will make alert noises to help you find it. Was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: christa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!😍
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I was skeptical but i ran it 3 times putting the North Star in different places, but it did awesome in each location. I’m hoping the battery doesn’t wear too much over time. Life saver! 2 cats, a large dog and a 4yo! 😍 Months later and I still love this thing!! I started using the swifter duster disposable clothes, too. Works great with them!
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH P PACHNIK

customer_reviews.title: It's a great compromise
customer_reviews.text: After a lengthy research I chose this mop! It didn't disappointed me because I had my expectations checked before buying it! Indeed it may left some marks on the floor but will almost vanish after the floor is dry. It also depends on the cleaning products used on the mop. It saves me time to spend with my family, which is priceless
customer_reviews.author: LeilaGR

customer_reviews.title: Last only a little more than one year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this robot for 1 year and 4 months. Generally it works fine, although sometimes get stuck here and there. This is the third IRobot I bought. Like the other two, this irobot doesn't last long. This one stops working after 1 year and 3 months, with very mild usage. The customer service is good, replying the phone calls in time. But it cost more than $40 to replace a battery and probably $70 to replace a charger according to customer service. So I face a dilemma to throw it away ($250) or spend more money on it. I choose the later choice and hopefully it could last another year. I will update after one year.
customer_reviews.author: Jiang Hu

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quick shine.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. It's great for the front entry where we just always have feetprints where our shoes were wet etc. it just doesn't mop in a fantastic pattern like the Roomba vacuums. This gets the job done. However, think of this as an automatic swiffer. It's not going to clean up the spilt milk and crushed banana off of the floor from your threenado child and learning to feed their self baby. I soak the reusable pads I purchased in a water and pinesol mixture and do water in the chamber. I then splash some extra pinesol around where it will be mopping.
customer_reviews.author: Sara, mom of three

customer_reviews.title: Love my shiny clean floors
customer_reviews.text: I have a Roomba for vacuuming & bought this on an impulse for mopping, then felt bad for spending the money. After using it a couple of times, I'm really glad I got it. I have 2 labs that track wet, muddy feet onto my wood floors. The Braava is amazing! It is extremely quiet & does an excellent job. It stays charged long enough to clean my 1200 s.f. house. I'll admit it's pretty slow, but it really gets the floors clean & doesn't leave the wood too wet. It is a space saver during charging as it sits on its end against the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Janice S.

customer_reviews.title: Silent and awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mop from the Amazon warehouse and it has exceeded my expectations. I used it solely in my kitchen and dining room to mop under where my 5, 3, and 2 year olds eat. I was amazed. Also, this thing sounds like heavy breathing. It is super quiet and I actually lost it in my kitchen. I would recommend this to anyone! Not sure on large areas, but for smaller areas it is great (the area I used it on is probably about 12 x 25)
customer_reviews.author: Dbs0003

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review this product and now that I have had it for 3 years I can safely say it works. I does all my hardwood floors. I let it run and when it returns to the base I push the button to run it again. Twice the clean for a charge. I have had to change the battery once a year. I bought them on Amazon for a low price. They are rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: DianaR

customer_reviews.title: A very good robot for light cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent machine for damp mopping floors. I would not use it in heavily soiled areas, but if, like me, you have light traffic and dust it does a really nice job. It is super quiet and gets under chairs and table well. It will run for about two hours on a charge. It will recharge in about the same amount of time. I would recommend getting extra cleaning cloths as you really need to rinse or change the cloth fairly often for best cleaning. All in all, this little robot is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kreader

customer_reviews.title: It's very quiet and does a good job on granite tile floors
customer_reviews.text: It's very quiet and does a good job on granite tile floors. It's really just pushing a wet rag around the floor and doesn't spray. The rag is kept wet with a drip reservoir. For some reason, I was thinking that this unit would spray. Granite tile floors have a sheen to them when they're cleaned well and it's really tough to get that sheen with this unit unless we run the unit multiple times with a clean rag each time. It's much easier than mopping, though. We have a Roomba that sweeps every day and the Braava mops once a week in the kitchen. I wish the Roomba was as quiet as the Braava.
customer_reviews.author: lvmobile

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and quiet. You wet the pad, add water to a reservoir, and then it just runs forward and back, forward and back, just like if you were mopping with something like a Swiffer mop. We have dark wood floors that need polishing, which I still have to do from time to time, but this is great for keeping the floor clean in between. Additionally, we have extremely high ceilings (15-20 ft) that have weird angles everywhere, and the little wayfinder box seems to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Xyrana

customer_reviews.title: IRobot NEEDS TO FIX RESERVOIR PAD
customer_reviews.text: First, I Love this little robot! It really cleans the floors exceptionally well! Even when I don’t see dirt - the cleaning pads (I bought a lot of extras) are filthy after it cleans. BUT IRobot needs to do something about the reservoir pad! It breaks - cracks after only a few uses! There’s definitely a design failure here, check the reviews! Replacing it cost $40 - it should be replaced during the first year - FREE by IRobot!
customer_reviews.author: JKMR

customer_reviews.title: You need this if you have cats..that have hair...lots of hair...
customer_reviews.text: I have cats. 3 cats. Hardwood floors throughout the house. Dark floors. Every other day I send out my little robot and he just quietly goes about the business of cleaning up dust and cat hair. He fits were cats can fit. Ideal. Soooo much hair! You need to hand clean spots and corners but for regular sweeping and wiping up this little robot is a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Tripper

customer_reviews.title: Nice to keep floors clean
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn’t order because of the reviews and almost returned it when i saw the size compared to the size of my house. I charged it and got one room ready for it. Amazing!! Love this thing! I do sections at a time. Dining room, then kitchen and so on. If you are planning on doing the whole house at once then this is not for you! Also, this work as a “to keep the floor clean” not ad a deep cleaning. You can mop on Sunday and use this daily as a keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Cielo

customer_reviews.title: Sucks!
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used this thing it did great, covered the first floor just fine...now it can't go 10' without giving up, beeping and blinking red. Totally useless P.O.S. Very frustrated and this is only the 3rd week since opening it. To make matters worse, Amazon shows the purchase in 2016 instead of 2018 when we actually purchased it so our warrantly and customer support are pooched too. AUGH!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good product to use after irobot vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I’m happy with this product. I used the mop function after the iRobot vacuum. I will probably use the dry mop first next time. It does a good job and doesn’t leave the hardwood floors too damp. It obviously can’t remove tough stains and pick up a lot but is a nice option for cleaning the floors. I would recommend buying a lot of cleaning cloths with it as one of each isn’t enough!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R

customer_reviews.title: Dirty Harry
customer_reviews.text: Did much research and decided to purchase this for our hardwood floors. I am pleased with the robot as it does a good job picking up pet hair and light mopping of said floors. Battery life is pretty good and it does get hung up on rugs so remove those. It also can get stuck but does overall a good purchase and saves us much time for the dog hair and dust. btw - wifey is a big fan and named him dirty harry!
customer_reviews.author: BigPapi

customer_reviews.title: "Moptimus Prime"
customer_reviews.text: The Braava 380t is iRobot's mopping robot. It's an upgrade to the Braava 320, an older model with lower battery capacity and less cleaning efficiency. The Braava line is often compared to the Roomba, iRobot's line of more advanced robotic vacuums. Generally, the Roomba is preferable to the Braava, as the Roomba can clean hard floors and vacuum carpets, while the Braava is limited to hard floors. However, the Roomba vacuums are more expensive, and the Braava can clean hard floors better, so I would recommend the Roomba if you only want your hard floors cleaned or if you're concerned with price (but if you're in the market for a robotic cleaning machine, price probably isn't your biggest problem).
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: The velcro doesn't stick
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but since the beginning the velcro that attaches the cleaning pads to the robot was loose and it needs to be reattached constantly. I purchased it to use out of the US so by the time I was able to try to get help with it, the guarantee period was over and they did not offer any guarantee, only suggested to buy replacement parts. Other than that, the cleaning is good enough for keeping the house clean. Some deeper cleaning is needed from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Xpresso Diario

customer_reviews.title: The mop container constantly breaks
customer_reviews.text: Had it for three years. I noticed that our floor gets wet a lot after 6 months and after I talked to one of the technician at iRobot, I noticed that there were some cracks on the mopping container. I replaced it which was costed $60. After a month of usage (4x in a month) it cracked again. And now the rubber wheel is loos and it's not working. Buy the extended warranty! YOU WILL NEED IT.
customer_reviews.author: Min Kim

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: We got the Roomba last year and loved it so we thought we would try this. it works better as a wet mop than just a dry mop. It's super quiet and gets around pretty good. What I found is if I sprinkle some water around the floor and turn it on on the wet mop mode it works really good. I don't think it would really do big deep stains or clean your grout but for General keeping up with things falling on the floor it's pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Coolest thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS!!!! The 6 hours a day scrubbing the floor is a thing of the past. Oh my aching back! Now I am a young spring chicken again! Its almost spooky how it moves across the floor and when it hits something, it will stop and its little blue lights blink like its thinking. It has an incredible range. It lasts a good 2 hours in mopping mode on a full charge. It lasts almost 4 in sweeping mode. It takes about two hours to recharge it and then its ready to go again. I have used it only 4 times so far but so far so good. I hope it lasts forever!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great mop just one flaw.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this little robot sure it doesn't do a hard scrubing but now she doesn't have to do it every other day this helps with keeping the floor clean and sweep, the only problem that I had is that with the vacuum ones they go over the metal threshold that I have between rooms but this Irobot doesn't so it can only clean one room at a time just sucks that when it is done I have to pick it up and put it in another room were the other one just goes off at night and cleans the house.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Naquin

customer_reviews.title: Replace Braava 380 yearly (only $225 year!)
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for over $200 that lasted just over the limited warranty period of one year. iRobot customer service were relatively easy to reach out to in troubleshooting a problem (only cleaning a few rows then stoping)....but determined that mine was no longer good without giving a specific reason. They offered the purchase of an identical hunk of plastic at a 15% discount. Uh ya...no. This company had the market cornered for a while but there are several other options I’ll be looking into for a robot mop
customer_reviews.author: John Michael Stanko

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a very good job of cleaning my mothers floor. It is absolutely quiet which is a good thing except for the fact it’s easy to trip over it because it is quiet. I added a warning light to the top so my 89-year-old mother doesn’t trip on it it looks pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: Ken F.

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in Nov '18. In less than a year it has already stopped working. Unfortunately I did not have the foresight to purchase the protection plan. The mopping power has been the equivalent of a light Swiffer mop. It does alright in the living room but is a pain for other rooms as you have to move the mop and the sensor box into the other room and it does not map these other rooms as it was moved.
customer_reviews.author: arramies

customer_reviews.title: Does good job wish it was more Automated
customer_reviews.text: Good overall product wish a little bit smarter but does a great job requires a second battery operated device to control together affective clean and Hass to be manually put on it out of charge and manually turn on versus like a smart robot vacuum that would go to his own charging station and do it on the app but really great I am very happy
customer_reviews.author: doug macdermott

customer_reviews.title: Great companion to our roomba
customer_reviews.text: We bought it used but excellent condition.... the battery was so dead we had to order another one, so about a week after we got it we used it. We love it, works great on hard wood floors, cleans up mud the dog and kids brings in and does it without complaining.
customer_reviews.author: William R Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be soap compatible
customer_reviews.text: The mop itself cleans well if you're maintaining your clean floor. The robot isn't strong enough to remove dried on spots on the first pass. For Juice I have noticed it at least takes 3-4 passes. If you like cleaning with water this is the mop for you. It isn't supposed to be used with cleaning solutions because the solution would damage the foam wheels.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: it's ok but not helpful enough for me
customer_reviews.text: The mop robot is a ok one. Pros: when it moves in a smaller room, it can finish sooner. With the water container it has and the wet mop, it can clean the floor ok. Cons: need to carry it to different rooms, it can't cross the tiny border between a bedroom room and a bathroom. need to pick and place the navigation helper to different rooms. need to wash the mop often. It's a bit slow, doesn't fully cover every place, and take long time and use up it's battery when cleaning my living room which is 300-400 sq ft.
customer_reviews.author: pp

customer_reviews.title: Pro-Clean Reservoir cracks and velcro peels off
customer_reviews.text: I have recently purchased the Braava on November 27, 2016. I was using only iRobot Scooba Hardfloor Cleaning Concentrate. Today I've noticed the the whole cleaning reservoir plastic housing is cracked. Also the Velcro started to peel off. I'm really disappointed to the robot broke just 2-3 months after I've purchased it. The navigation is really bad. It's chaotic in comparison with my Neato Botvac Connected. It's really disappointing that they don't have a mop.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: and does a pretty good job overall
customer_reviews.text: I run it daily, and it gets the majority of the spots on the tile. I have to refill it and clean the cloth half way through its cleaning cycle for my living room, dining room and kitchen. Its very quiet, and does a pretty good job overall. I can clean much better than it can, but that's not the point of getting one of these, and i am very happy that it met my expectations! I shouldn't have to mop anymore if i let it run daily!
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've had robot vacuums and robot moppers which both had to be emptied after use. With this, only a change of cloth is needed, and boy do I love it. I use it at home on hardwood and in my very small shop on vinyl tile, and my floors are cleaner than they have been since they were new. I use it almost every day, because I can see the results on the used cloths as well as on the floors, and it's very satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J Dowell

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great little machine, but it loses a star because I have to refill the pad holder more often than I'd like. It'd be nice if iRobot could develop a holder with a far greater capacity. Otherwise, this little gem does a very nice job. I typically use it for mopping, but, since it sits so low, it is perfect as a dry mop for getting the dust under the bed!
customer_reviews.author: ThinkmanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I use weekly on my bamboo floors and they never have looked better. Gets under furniture that I seldom got under ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day. Keeps my kitchen floor spotless with hardly any effort. I use weekly on my bamboo floors and they never have looked better. Gets under furniture that I seldom got under with a conventional mop. I do keep it on it's charger when not in use. It's water only so you do need to mop occasionally with a cleanser but with daily use of the robot I have found once a month will do.
customer_reviews.author: Edie

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!! I have had the same issue twice within a year. The rubber has become loose on the wheels and the robot just goes in circles and shuts off. Obviously this is a design defect. I do not reccomend this product, it is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: z. zabinski

customer_reviews.title: worked quite well until battery failed after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this robot when it was working. It is not as "independent" as my Eufy robotic vacuum cleaners, and needs some babysitting (turning the cube back on, getting it unstuck, restarting it). But given the option of having to map myself I'm ok doing so. The charging cradle never worked (from day 1) and I have always used the direct plug-in option. Now, after about 2 months of occasional use the battery is not charging at all. Customer Service will supply me with a new battery, as my robot is still under warranty. I will upgrade my rating to 4 stars, if the new battery has a better lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: tpie

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job on my floors
customer_reviews.text: We have wood floors that are new and were premium pre-finished. We don't have pets so there is no dog or cat hair to deal with. The little robot under our conditions does a very good job overall. It finds its way around objects and scrubs back and forth. The only thing that it doesn't get is something that needs to be scrubbed like a bit of food the kids dropped that dried. It is quiet and hardly makes a sound.
customer_reviews.author: AUTiger

customer_reviews.title: Great at cleaning up residual chemicals in between heavy duty mop jobs!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Braava months ago and have used it several times now. It is quiet, and does its job as promised, but like what other reviewers have said, it can only be relied on for light cleaning. Used only filtered water with it, usually in between heavier swiffer mop jobs, to clean up residual chemicals. Leaves our tiled floor feeling less sticky and more clean! Just wished that it can maneuver out of the kitchenette nook into the dining and living area more effectively. Sort of have to help Braava out with getting around despite the auto-navigator it comes with. Still, a great companion to the Roomba we have for the carpeted areas upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: jL

customer_reviews.title: like giving a floor mop to a three year old
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for six months now. It is ok but was way below my expectation. It barely applies any pressure while mopping because it is so lightweight (just like giving a floor mop to a three year old). Unfortunately we still have to do our regular floor mopping the traditional way and use this little thing occasionally to pick up light dirt or dust. I also noticed that sometimes the robot got confused and keep circling in the same area for long and sometimes it just sit idle until we pick it app and hit the start button again.
customer_reviews.author: Omer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love , love it!!! My best purchase ever...it leaves the floors squeaky clean...I haven’t used the sweep mode much, but I use it twice a week for mopping and absolutely love it, can’t say much for durability as I have only owned it about a month, the battery life is decent it covers the foyer, kitchen and breakfast nook with still battery to spare...Don’t regret buying this at all...the mapping device on this one is awesome, I bought a roomba too along with this and I will be returning that it does nothing for my open floor plan.
customer_reviews.author: Deepa

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY Wanted To Like This, But No...
customer_reviews.text: I hate mopping and really wanted to like this product, but nope. This works as it should (watch the YouTube videos), but it turns out that it is too slow for me and too much work. I seem to follow it around a lot, changing the pad and squirting liquid floor cleaner in front of it (the water container doesn't disperse very much). In the time it takes for the robot to complete a small room, I could whip out a Swiffer for much less money. I love my iRobot Roomba vacuum, but I would not buy this iRobot Mopping Robot again.
customer_reviews.author: SeaGal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smooth floors
customer_reviews.text: This robot will efficiently and almost silently clean your floors with microfiber cloths. If you've ever used a Swiffer, that's how this unit functions; it is *not* a vacuum. Unlike the vacuum iRobot models, this one does not move randomly, but rather uses the navigation unit to track its location and move in straight lines (which is much more efficient in my opinion and observation). The one major function I miss compared to my vacuum robot is that the Braava cannot return to its charging dock automatically. However it does return to its starting point (and beeps) when it has finished a room. Overall I love this robot and feel it is perfect for cleaning smooth floors.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Battery life dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I actually love my little robot and he works great on my floors, but I have had to replace the battery twice since I bought it two years ago. It's now out of warranty and they say it's $50 to replace again. I really don't think that's acceptable. It's a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much useless
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, does not work as expected. Cannot get out of the kitchen because of the tiny border - one that our robot vacuum (another brand) gets over easily. Cannot really navigate - cleans in straight lines and cannot even go around the bed. Basically needs too much hand-holding for an automatic thingy. Loses charge pretty fast, too.
customer_reviews.author: SF Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Just push a button and go. I like that one can use any similar sized microfiber cloth, no need to get the OEM ones. But the OEM ones seems to be decent quality cloth. Very quiet on the hardwood. One cannot notice it when it is running. It does make a small sound when it hits stuff and backs off. It cleans fast and efficiently when GPS is open. Only compliant is that they could make it automatic recharge. But overall I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: sourdough

customer_reviews.title: Mop head defect
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of use, the tape on the mop head peeled back. The only way to rectify this defect is to buy a new mop head. I asked customer service for suggestions and all they could suggest was to buy a new mop head. They can only suggest what iRobot sells. Useless. I'm going to try double-sided adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: Rescue Cats' Mom

customer_reviews.title: I use the Braava everyday, and it works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the Braava a lot. It works really well dusting the floors and mopping the floors. Just using it the first few times I could see how much cleaner my floors were. The only problem is that it goes everywhere and sometimes it will get stuck under a piece of furniture. They don't have means of stopping it from going into places that it will get caught in wires or such. The Roomba vacuum has that feature. Even though, it's great and I got one for my daughter-in-law for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Charging issues
customer_reviews.text: Our Braava lasted for about 2 years and does not want to charge anymore. Had multiple calls with the iRobit tech support for several hours who could not diagnose the issue and was finally asked to purchase a new robot. Was Satisfied when it worked. However, extremely disappointed with the durability or the tech support.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this but I ended up returning it. Mine may have been defective. It seemed to get lost and it kept cleaning the same spot over and over. My house is open plan so I should have easily seen the navigation cube but I found myself constantly having to rescue it and put it back in another location. Anyway, I like robotic cleaners and have a vacuum that I like. I plan to try the Braava Jet 240 instead of this and see if it is any better.
customer_reviews.author: IrishLass

customer_reviews.title: Big price for poor return.
customer_reviews.text: It took quite a while, not the real issue. Because it didn't do more than collect it really didn't make it so I didn't need to clean the floors. We have lots of women with long hair so lots of hair in the floor, once it has all the hair it can hold, it really just shoves crap around. For the price it's not enough of a time or labor saver. I would not recommend it to anyone. I'm just sad I missed my return window by not using it enough to decide I really don't like it in adequate time.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Oveson

customer_reviews.title: Battery problem
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well for 6 months. I like the motion of robot when sweeping on floor. But after 6 months, it only run for 2-3 minutes and stop even I charged battery for whole night. I don’t know why?!?!? You can easily check “Brava 380 problems” on youtube and see a lot of problems happen with Brava. One of these problems is the robot stop after 2-3 minutes run. May be the battery die? So $254 for 6 months work is not worth! It’s too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Thao Vu

customer_reviews.title: It's not a wet mop equivalent to a top of the line Roomba Vac
customer_reviews.text: But it will adequately wet mop a lightly-soiled tile floor. Don't expect it to scrub a floor without first having the floor swept clean. It will just push the dirt around. Eventually Roomba will make a wet mop robot that is as good as the 980 vacuum. But that day is still in the future.
customer_reviews.author: jabloomf1230

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 stars as it is missing some of the nice functionality that I enjoy in my Roomba
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars as it is missing some of the nice functionality that I enjoy in my Roomba. It is missing WiFi connectivity and notices. It needs a larger fluid reservoir. It would be nice if it returns to base on its own and recharges. It is more of a one room mop as it requires an external cube. It is a drip fluid system vs. a spray. I think that it is worthwhile for the price. I would just hope that IRobot comes out with a unit that has more features in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Southwest

customer_reviews.title: I recommend carefully examining this robot for cracks as I truly ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize why exactly the Braava wasn't working properly. It arrived with cracks in the reservoir, so all of the water leaks out at once. Unfortunately, I spent most of June on vacation and didn't realize there was a problem. Apparently, thirty days is all the time given for the return process. I recommend carefully examining this robot for cracks as I truly didn't see them. I just kept wondering why it would dry out so quickly. I'm hoping that the company will assist me and will update this review if I receive a response.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Tatum

customer_reviews.title: Good for small areas if you run it frequently.
customer_reviews.text: It will keep a small floor clean if you run it every day. Wish it could dock itself or had some way of locating it when it dies under a couch. Like a Roomba, its nonsensical mopping pattern is maddening, so don't watch it in action. It gets the job done eventually. Would be nice to have something to constrain its working area, like Roomba has.
customer_reviews.author: Stevil

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job of moping the floors one room at a ...
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of moping the floors one room at a time. I like the fact that you can use swifter wet mop refill wipes. I usually start off with a swifter wipe and then use the moping cloth. Leaves my floors very clean. It takes about 30 Minutes to mop the floors. It’s so quiet that I often forget it’s running. Overall I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carla M

customer_reviews.title: Couple of tips
customer_reviews.text: Love using this daily - my tips are use the Swiffer XL mopping pads and the dry sweeping mode - it really gets the edges/molding and covers more surface area in a shorter amount of time then the wet mode which is for deeper cleaning. (Flip pad midway for more cleaning)
customer_reviews.author: MCollett

customer_reviews.title: This only wet your floor not mop your floor
customer_reviews.text: Returned back to Amazon, this one cannot really mop your floor, it can only "wet" your floor. Compare with spray mop which can clean the marks, stains on the floor, this one only wet your floor that cannot clean the stains or marks at all. I bought it because iRobot is good for this kinds of product but I am very disappointing with this mop robot.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its not a vacuum, its a mop and sweeper
customer_reviews.text: It works great. We mainly use it for mopping. You are not supposed to use chemicals so it is nice if you want to just use water. It does work at getting up footprints on the wood floor. I like that you can wash the wiping pads in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: B Ryan Like the Bird

customer_reviews.title: A decent sweeper/duster.
customer_reviews.text: This won't replace a good mopping, but its great for dry dusting. The Swiffer dry sheets work best, but the microfiber dry cloths wok OK too. For wet mopping, use the cloth microfiber and get some extras. The wet Swiffer type sheets don't cut it. One rather major design issue: The robot is slightly wedge shaped, and frequently gets stuck under overhangs like the fridge door. It should be tallest in the front so it can't keep going under things it can't get clear of.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Braava. The first one’s belts and batteries are all broken right after one year of purchase. Since it’s really a very useful machine, I would like to give it a second chance. If you are planing to use it for years, I recommend you buy a extended warranty plan with it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great product for damp mopping
customer_reviews.text: We love this mop. I was a bit disappointed at first because I thought it was more of a floor washer. It's great for damp mopping and I've found that if I use it often enough, it keeps the floors very clean. It's very methodical and doesn't miss a spot
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Pineau

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option for such price
customer_reviews.text: You constantly need to buy replacement for the small-cap that controls how much water use it doesn't auto park, so you need taking off and put it on every time. o option to connect to phone Considering how much iRobot's product costs, I think they need to do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel V Shcherbakov

customer_reviews.title: Did a great job for me
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job for me. Even on very difficult dried spills. Also so quiet I have to keep checking to see if it is still going. :o)
customer_reviews.author: greyslady

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my soon to be daughter in law
customer_reviews.text: I know my son loves it and his fiancée said it’ works great on the floors they just bought there 1st home it’s a very big home with hardwood floors throughout expect for the bathroom’s and it works great on the tile. There best thing they like is when they come home from work and they don’t have to break their backs vacuuming and washing the floors they can put it in any room that needs cleaning and washing and they can eat dinner. I love it I plan on buying another one for my daughter she has two toddlers they are always dropping food they can’t help it there so little I know she’s going to be So happy..
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Labor Saver
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this does not take the place of a good mopping and elbow grease to clean the floors. However, if you run it regularly your floors should look decent and you'll not be embarrassed if you have company. We have a dark laminate floors and you always saw the residue on the floor from feet, spills and the dog. Since I got this helper the floors look good enough to that my wife doesn't complain. I am retired and she still has to work. Between the iRobot Roomba and this Brasva I have a lot more time to do fun things.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C Berwick

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: waste of money. Yes cleans some areas but not as thorough and well as it should for the price. You will probably need about 3 of those sensors since one will not work. The cleaning also is hardly the same as mopping since it feels like just rubbing the surface of the wood. I will not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: solid gold

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have tried more sophisticated models but they all have tech glitches and other quirks. Finally I went back to this tried-and-true machine. My older model lasted 5 years so I am happy to replace it with this one. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Daily Maintenance!!!! A True Time Saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this item. It is great for daily maintenance. However, there is a video demonstration of this product on YouTube criticizing the Bravaa’s inability to clean flour and dirt from a sample floor. This product is not for cleaning extremely filthy floors! You need to thoroughly clean your floor using conventional methods of your choice before engaging the Bravaa. This should be common sense😊 We have a large dog that drools and we have found a solution for daily cleaning! This is absolutely wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Under Perfect Conditions It May Get Your Floor Wet
customer_reviews.text: In two weeks I have given up trying to get this to work more often than it has worked. The navigation almost never connects, and the Braava sends the "Fail" beep after 3 minutes of spinning in circles. I assume it would work if you had a perfectly open, square room with unobstructed views of a low ceiling from all areas, and the cube could float somewhere in the middle of the room somehow. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T.

customer_reviews.title: Factory model works like new!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a "used" unit at more than 50% off (Amazon Warehouse). I was pleasantly surprised. It arrived in mint condition with a clean and brand-new look. As with a new model( which I've bought before) it is a life saver. Sweeps and mops great!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.LL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This product does not deep clean. It changes the way you clean your house. You still need to deep clean your floors. But this bot maintains them and keeps them sparkling longer until that is possible. I run every day before I leave for work. I have four kids, a dog, a cat and a roomba that runs at 6am before I start the mop... daily. Life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Makes small smudge spots into bigger ones
customer_reviews.text: It's too light to put any pressure on a stain, so it only smudges it around. It would have been more effective if it had some kind of brushes that can brake down the dirt and then wipe it. I use the Robot Mop after I pass the Roomba, and I can see smudge lines all over the kitchen floor. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: So far loving it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived last week so far it works great. Ordered more mop pads both wet and dry. This thing does a very good job. Picks up alot after dirt from our vinal laminate floors. Also ordered the concentrated cleaner for it. We have the rumba also also like it alot that's what lead us to the robot mop. Does it replace a good cleaning no but it really helps keep dog and cat hair at bay. Our floors never looked better
customer_reviews.author: RKEYS

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little robot. It works flawlessly. I have hard wood floors and it does a great job. I found that if I want to get a better more concentrated clean, I put the North Star cube facing in a specific direction. This works for the area in front of my cook top and sink where I have more spills and in front of the dog bowls with more drool or wetness from water. I use the cleaner from the manufacturer and it works well and smells nice. I have one wet cloth that I just clean by using soap and water. I am very happy with this robot and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and wake up to super clean floors
customer_reviews.text: We had the older version for years and this does a phenomenal job. Use this on a weekly basis. Set it when we go to bed, and wake up to super clean floors.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend Warrior

customer_reviews.title: So close to being great, but it doesn't quite get there
customer_reviews.text: Just be sure you know what you are getting here. This is more of an automated swifter mop and not a full scrubbing unit. You will need to mop (or shark) every week or 2. I'm will be happy to know know when shark comes out with their own version of this. Steam would easily give this think 5 stars! The other issue is that this is for use with WATER only. Even something as simple as Murphy's oil makes the unit not work properly. A simple R&D fix could solve this. The detergent won't pass the "water dispenser" material. A different material would make it work great.
customer_reviews.author: Erb Avore

customer_reviews.title: There are better robots for the same price
customer_reviews.text: Was a decent floor swiffer (not a mop) for about a year, then quit working. Maybe a sensor issue. Required 2 charges to clean 5 rooms. Had to buy wheels to get better traction. Wheels were $23 on Amazon, IRobot wanted $79. I recently replaced with ILife 400, which is a far better robot for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Does not clean
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this! I have the vacuum and I love it, but this is nothing more than a wet wipe lightly wiping your floor. It can't wipe up anything sticky, footprints etc. Such a waste of money and it can't be returned on Amazon. If you do buy any of their products please buy them from the site, they have specials all the time and they can be returned if you are not happy.....my husband did not do his research....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: iRobot Braava 380t Advanced Robot Mop- Wet Mopping and Dry Sweeping Cleaning Modes, Large Spaces
product_meta.description: Style Name:Braava MopDesigned to mop floors quickly and efficiently, the new iRobot Braava Floor Mopping Robot systematically covers your entire floor in a single pass. Braava uses disposable or microfiber cleaning cloths to pick up dirt, hair and dust from all your hardsurface floors including tile, vinyl, hardwood and laminate. Just attach a cloth, set Braava down, press a button and off it goes, using advanced robotic technology to track where it's been and where it needs to go. It's whisper quiet too, so you can go about your daily activities without disruption. The included Turbo Charge Cradle is a convenient, one stop charging and storage space, charging Braava 380t in as fast as two hours. Braava uses either disposable cleaning cloths, including Swiffer brand, or reusable microfiber cloths to remove dirt, dust and hair from your floors so you don't have to. Braava has two cleaning modes to choose from depending on the job you need done. In sweep mode, Braava dry mops your floors moving in straight lines using dry cleaning cloths. In mop mode, Braava uses a special back and forth mopping action and damp cleaning cloths to lift surface dirt and grime off your floors. With the Pro Clean System included in Braava 380t, a special Reservoir Cleaning Pad dispenses liquid throughout the cleaning cycle to keep the cloth damp. Cleaning cloths are easy to attach and remove with Braava's removable magnetic multi purpose cleaning pad. The NorthStar Navigation System 2 works like an indoor GPS that helps Braava keep track of where it has been and where it needs to go. The NorthStar Navigation Cube projects a signal that Braava uses to determine its location. Additional NorthStar Navigation Cubes can be purchased for the Braava 380t to expand the robot's dry mopping capabilities for bigger homes. Note: Trouble shooting steps available in pages 24 26.
feature_bullets: Capacity volume: 0.25 gallon; Advanced Robot Mop with Pro clean system enables triple pass mopping action for everyday dirt and grime
Designed to mop and sweep hardwood, tile, and stone; Just attach a cleaning pad and press Mop or Sweep
Cleans multiple rooms and large spaces; Navigates around objects and under furniture
IAdapt 2.0 Navigation helps Braava keep track of where it's been and where it needs to go
Maximized edge design gets into corners and along edges; Cleans under furniture and in other hard to reach places
Fast and convenient with the Turbo Charge Cradle
Works with variety of cleaning cloths; Compatible with iRobot reusable microfiber cloths or other disposable cleaning cloths
Northstar cube technology provides expandable cleaning range with additional cubes
